div.p: So I’m starting up a business but also I need the money from my other job really to pay my bills, my mortgage so I’ve got to keep some
income coming in; I might have a bad week where I don’t get any clients and I need to pay, you know you’ve still got your bills to pay
so until I build up a secure client base I’ll have to keep working 6 days a week. It is like a form of therapy so you do find
you could be doing someone’s nails and they will start opening up to you and sometimes it’s hard, you don’t want to get too involved,
you don’t want to ask them too many questions you just need to let them sort of offload on you so sometimes that can be quite challenging
especially when they’re talking about upsetting things but also it’s nice as well that they feel like they can do that so you must be
doing something right if they feel quite comfortable around you which is what I’m sure most beauty therapists would want to do
with their clients, make them feel at ease
